experiment.title: NIR reflectance spectra of PMMA slabs and granular layers of varying thickness and grain sizes over various substrates, planetary ices analog
experiment.description: NIR reflectance spectra of PMMA slabs and granular layers of varying thickness (2 to 12mm) and grain sizes (0.4-0.8 and 0.8-2mm) over various substrates (black or white paper, sand, granular PMMA). In the NIR, PMMA can be considered as a planetary ices analog

section.title: PMMA slabs over PMMA grains over paper
section.description: PMMA slabs over PMMA grains over paper. The granular layer of PMMA is optically thick. The PMMA grains were obtained crushing a PMMA plate, and then sieving into two grain size ranges: 0.4-0.8 mm and 0.8-2mm. Slabs of PMMA of thicknesses 2mm, 4mm and 6mm, and combinations of them were placed on top of the optically thick PMMA granular layer.

spectrum.title: NIR reflectance spectra of 2 mm PMMA slab over black paper
spectrum.analysis: The spectra were acquired on a SPECIM SWIR hyperspectral camera. Black and white reference are taken before each measurement. SNR is above 50. Each individual spectra is then obtained manually by ROI averaging on the hyperspectral image, the reduce roughness effects, and local facets geometry variations effects.
